segments.text: I see the water overflowing, and it makes me so angry.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, doing nothing about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s drying a plate like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being sneaky, and she doesn’t even notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is about to fall off that stool, and she’s just ignoring everything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is waiting for a cookie, and it’s like no one cares about the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so perfect, but inside, it’s a disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how careless everyone is being.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is going to ruin the floor, and no one is doing anything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could just walk over there and turn off the faucet myself.
segments.speaker: PAR
